lom:description.lom:string:
The TEC Review is a searchable online database that highlights peer-reviewed curriculum in the fields of technology and engineering. The database assists teachers in locating quality curriculum materials that teach technology and engineering principles at all K-12 grade levels. There are over 600 materials listed in the TEC Review database, and more than a third of these curriculum pieces have been evaluated by a team of technology and engineering education professionals. The materials were examined in terms of student assessment, teacher support, connections to curriculum standards, and overall usability.
This project stems from the National Center for Technological Literacy (NCTL), which aims integrate engineering as a new discipline in schools nationwide and to inspire the next generation of engineers and innovators. For more information about the NCTL, visit http://www.nctl.org
